Rotation

Idea:

glRotatef(angle, x, y, z) allows one to rotate an object about any axis. In the above function, angle specifies the angle by which to rotate, and x, y, and z specify the axis of rotation. Specifically, the object is rotated by angle (in degrees) in a counter clockwise (CCW) direction about the ray from the origin to (x, y, z), i.e. if the rotation is viewed from (x, y, z) looking towards the origin it appears CCW. For example (30, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0) would rotates 30 degrees about the X-axis.
